SEARCH
Module com.github.sttk.cliargs
Package com.github.sttk.cliargs

Class OptCfg

java.lang.Object
com.github.sttk.cliargs.OptCfg
public class OptCfg extends Object
Is the class that represents an option configuration. An option configuration consists of fields: storeKey, names, hasArg, isArray, type, defaults, desc, argInHelp, and converter.

This class can be instantiated by the constructor with variadic arguments of OptCfg.NamedParam like named parameters, for example: 


  import static com.github.sttk.cliargs.OptCfg.NamedParam.*;

    var optCfg = new OptCfg(names("foo-bar", "f"), type(Integer.class));

    Is the functional interface to process option arguments after parsing command line arguments.

  • Field Details

    • storeKey

      public final String storeKey
      Is the key string to store option value(s) in the option map. If this key is not specified or empty, the first element of names field is used instead.

    • names

      public final List<String> names
      Is the option name and aliases. This is the string list and the order of the names is used in a help text.

    • hasArg

      public final boolean hasArg
      Is the flag which indicates whether allowing the option to take option arguments.

    • isArray

      public final boolean isArray
      Is the flag which indicates whether allowing the option to take multiple option arguments.

    • type

      public final Class<?> type
      Is the class which indicates the type of the option value or the element of the option values.

    • defaults

      public final List<?> defaults
      Is the default value(s) if the option takes the option argument(s) but it is not given in command line arguments.

    • desc

      public final String desc
      Is the description of the option. This is used in a help text.

    • argInHelp

      public final String argInHelp
      Is the display of the option argument in a help text.

    • converter

      public final Converter<?> converter
      Is the converter to convert an option argument string from command line arguments to the specified type value.

    • postparser

      public final OptCfg.Postparser<?> postparser
      Is the function interface that is executed after parsing command line arguments.

  • Constructor Details

    • OptCfg

      public OptCfg(String storeKey, List<String> names, boolean hasArg, boolean isArray, Class<T> type, List<T> defaults, String desc, String argInHelp, Converter<T> converter, OptCfg.Postparser<T> postparser)
      Is the constructor that takes the all field values as parameters.

      If storeKey is empty, it is set to first element of names. If names is empty or it's first element is empty, the first element is set to the value of storeKey.

      If type is not null but hasArg is false, hasArg is set to true forcely. Also, type is not null but converter is null, converter is set to a converter which convert a string to a specified type value.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the option argument value.
      Parameters:
      storeKey - The store key.
      names - The option name and aliases.
      hasArg - True, if this option can take option arguments.
      isArray - True, if this option can take one or multiple option arguments.
      type - The type of the option value.
      defaults - The default value(s).
      desc - The description of the option.
      argInHelp - The display of the option argument.
      converter - The Converter object to convert the option argument string to the specified type value.
      postparser - The OptCfg.Postparser object that is executed after parsing command line arguments.

    • OptCfg

      @SafeVarargs public OptCfg(OptCfg.NamedParam<T>... params)
      Is the constructor that takes the variadic parameters of OptCfg.NamedParam which can be specified like named parameters.

      If storeKey is empty, it is set to first element of names. If names is empty or it's first element is empty, the first element is set to the value of storeKey.

      If type is not null but hasArg is false, hasArg is set to true forcely. Also, type is not null but converter is null, converter is set to a converter which convert a string to a specified type value.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the option argument value.
      Parameters:
      params - The variadic parameters of OptCfg.NamedParam.
